1.text: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

3.text: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.

4.text: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.

5.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

6.text: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.

7.text: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.

8.text: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.

9.text: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:

10.text: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother's womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.

11.text: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?

12.text: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?

13.text: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

14.text: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;

15.text: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

16.text: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.

17.text: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.

18.text: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.

19.text: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.

20.text: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;

21.text: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;

22.text: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?

23.text: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?

24.text: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.

25.text: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.

26.text: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
